New Records: Indonesia broke a streak of not winning a group stage match in the Asian Cup since 2007
Key Match Events: Asnawi Mangkualam scored the only goal of the match in the 39th minute
Jordi Amat was taken off on a stretcher after being elbowed by a Vietnam player
Ernando Ari spectacularly saved a free kick by Vu Van Thanh in the 90+10th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Shin Tae-Yong promised an attacking play before the match
Indonesia is ranked 146th in the latest FIFA Rankings, while Japan is ranked 17th
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Shin lauded the performance of Asnawi Mangkualam
Coach Shin acknowledged the element of luck that played a role in Indonesia's win
A fan, Hadi, expressed pride and excitement to watch Indonesia play against Japan
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia climbed one spot to third place in the Group D standings with 3 points
Indonesia's victory paves the way for a potential match with Australia in the last 16
Indonesia will face Japan at Al Thumama Stadium in Doha, Qatar, on Wednesday at 18:30 WIB
